etymologies: Old English bī, bi, be, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch bij and German bei

definitions: identifying the agent performing an action.
after a passive verb

examples.text: the door was opened by my cousin Annie
damage caused by fire

definitions: after a noun denoting an action

examples.text: a clear decision by the electorate
further attacks by the mob

definitions: identifying the author of a text, idea, or work of art

examples.text: a book by Ernest Hemingway

definitions: indicating the means of achieving something

examples.text: malaria can be controlled by attacking the parasite
they plan to provide further working capital by means of borrowing

definitions: indicating a term to which an interpretation is to be assigned

examples.text: what is meant by “fair?”

shortDefinitions: indicating term to which interpretation is assigned

definitions: indicating a name according to which a person is known

examples.text: she mostly calls me by my last name

shortDefinitions: indicating name by which person is known

definitions: indicating the means of transport selected for a journey

examples.text: traveling by train to Boston

shortDefinitions: identifying means of transport for journey

definitions: indicating the other parent of someone's child or children

examples.text: Richard is his son by his third wife

shortDefinitions: indicating other parent of someone's child

definitions: indicating the sire of a pedigree animal, especially a horse

examples.text: a black filly by Goldfuerst

definitions: (followed by a noun without an adjective) in various phrases indicating how something happens

examples.text: I heard by chance that she has married again
Anderson, by contrast, rejects this view
she ate by candlelight

shortDefinitions: in phrases indicating how something happens

definitions: indicating the amount or size of a margin

examples.text: the shot missed her by miles
the raising of taxes by 2.5%

definitions: indicating a unit of measurement

examples.text: billing is by the minute

definitions: in phrases indicating something happening repeatedly or progressively, typically with repetition of a unit of time

examples.text: colors changing minute by minute
the risk becomes worse by the day

shortDefinitions: indicating something happening repeatedly or progressively

definitions: identifying a parameter

examples.text: a breakdown of employment figures by age and occupation

definitions: expressing multiplication, especially in dimensions

examples.text: a map measuring 24 by 36 inches
she multiplied it by 89

definitions: indicating a deadline or the end of a particular time period

examples.text: I've got to do this report by Monday
by now Kelly needed extensive physiotherapy

shortDefinitions: indicating deadline or end of time period

definitions: indicating location of a physical object beside a place or object

examples.text: remains were discovered by the roadside
the lamp was by the door

definitions: past and beyond

examples.text: I drove by our house

definitions: indicating the period in which something happens

examples.text: this animal always hunts by night

shortDefinitions: indicating period in which something happens

definitions: concerning; according to

examples.text: anything you do is all right by me
she had done her duty by him

definitions: used in mild oaths

examples.text: it was the least he could do, by God

definitions: so as to go past

examples.text: a car flashed by on the other side of the road
he let only a moment go by
